intro: Vicia galeata, commonly known as the common vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, featuring trifoliate leaves and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant produces slender, elongated pods that contain several seeds, which are often dispersed by wind. Vicia galeata is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in meadows. Its ability to fix nitrogen makes it an important plant in soil enrichment and ecological restoration.
